title: How to Make an Apple Crumble Yogurt

steps.headline: Divide the yogurt into two roughly equal portions into two of your chosen serving containers, such as bowls, cups, glasses - the choice is yours!
Divide the granola or oats into two equal amounts (each serving contains roughly 1/4 cup of oats/granola) and then place the oats or granola into each serving.
Peel your apple and cut it into small pieces.
steps.description: Remove the core and boil it in hot water for about 10-30 minutes or until softened.

steps.headline: Get out a blender and prepare it.
steps.description: Take your apples and then blend them until they are a paste of your chosen thickness - some like it chunky, some like it smooth. Add about 1/2 of the apple into each serving and stir with a teaspoon.

steps.headline: Add cinnamon to each serving and stir again.
steps.description: If you decided to use honey, add one tablespoon per serving and stir again.

steps.headline: Decorate it if you wish, and serve!
steps.description: Await any compliments - this apple crumble is surely delicious! Enjoy on a warm Spring day while reading a book or talking with friends.

text: Divide the yogurt into two roughly equal portions into two of your chosen serving containers, such as bowls, cups, glasses - the choice is yours!  Divide the granola or oats into two equal amounts (each serving contains roughly 1/4 cup of oats/granola) and then place the oats or granola into each serving. Stir with a teaspoon. Peel your apple and cut it into small pieces. Remove the core and boil it in hot water for about 10-30 minutes or until softened. Get out a blender and prepare it. Take your apples and then blend them until they are a paste of your chosen thickness - some like it chunky, some like it smooth. Add about 1/2 of the apple into each serving and stir with a teaspoon. Add cinnamon to each serving and stir again. If you decided to use honey, add one tablespoon per serving and stir again. Decorate it if you wish, and serve! Await any compliments - this apple crumble is surely delicious! Enjoy on a warm Spring day while reading a book or talking with friends.
